articles.title: PronunÈ›ia portughezÄƒ pentru Ã®ncepÄƒtori: Ghidul complet pentru cupluri
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Te gÃ¢ndeÈ™ti cum sÄƒ-i surprinzi pe partenerul tÄƒu portughez? PronunÈ›ia corectÄƒ este cheia pentru a-i face sÄƒ zÃ¢mbeascÄƒ È™i pentru a arÄƒta cÄƒ Ã®È›i pasÄƒ cu adevÄƒrat. Nu te Ã®ngrijora - portugheza poate pÄƒrea dificilÄƒ la Ã®nceput, dar cu puÈ›inÄƒ practicÄƒ Ã®mpreunÄƒ, veÈ›i descoperi cÄƒ este o limbÄƒ muzicalÄƒ È™i romanticÄƒ. PÃ¢nÄƒ la finalul acestui ghid, veÈ›i È™ti sÄƒ pronunÈ›aÈ›i cele mai importante cuvinte È™i expresii pentru cuplu!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Amo-te"
  translation="Te iubesc"
  pronunciation="AH-moh teh"
  context="Cea mai importantÄƒ declaraÈ›ie romanticÄƒ - perfectÄƒ pentru momentele speciale Ã®mpreunÄƒ."
/>

## Portugheza: Mai simplÄƒ decÃ¢t pare

Portugheza foloseÈ™te alfabetul latin, la fel ca romÃ¢na, dar cu cÃ¢teva sunete speciale. GÃ¢ndeÈ™te-te la ea ca la o melodie - odatÄƒ ce Ã®nveÈ›i ritmul, totul devine natural. Spre deosebire de romÃ¢nÄƒ, portugheza are sunete nazale care pot pÄƒrea ciudate la Ã®nceput, dar care dau limbii acel farmec specific.

### Cele 5 reguli de aur ale pronunÈ›iei

1. **Accentul cade de obicei pe penultima silabÄƒ** - similar cu romÃ¢na
2. **Vocalele nazale** se pronunÈ›Äƒ prin nas - ca atunci cÃ¢nd spui "mhm" Ã®n romÃ¢nÄƒ
3. **"R" la Ã®nceputul cuvintelor** se pronunÈ›Äƒ aproape ca "h" din englezÄƒ
4. **"S" Ã®ntre vocale** devine "z" - la fel ca Ã®n romÃ¢nÄƒ
5. **"L" la finalul cuvintelor** sunÄƒ ca "u" - dar nu te Ã®ngrijora, vei Ã®nvÄƒÈ›a treptat

## Sunetele portugheze esenÈ›iale

### Vocalele - inimÄƒ limbii

| PortughezÄƒ | PronunÈ›ie | Exemplu romÃ¢nesc |
|------------|-----------|------------------|
| **A** | "ah" | ca Ã®n "casÄƒ" |
| **E** | "eh" | ca Ã®n "bere" |
| **I** | "ee" | ca Ã®n "mic" |
| **O** | "oh" | ca Ã®n "sos" |
| **U** | "oo" | ca Ã®n "luna" |

<VocabCard
  word="Obrigado"
  translation="MulÈ›umesc"
  pronunciation="oh-bree-GAH-doh"
  example="Obrigado pelo jantar, meu amor!"
/>

### Consoanele speciale

**NH** - pronunÈ›at ca "gn" din francezul "campagne" sau aproape ca "ni" din "brÃ¢nzÄƒ":

<VocabCard
  word="Carinho"
  translation="AfecÈ›iune/dragoste"
  pronunciation="kah-REE-nyoh"
  example="Eu tenho muito carinho por vocÃª."
/>

**LH** - similar cu "li" din "familie", dar mai moale:

<VocabCard
  word="Folha"
  translation="FrunzÄƒ"
  pronunciation="FOL-yah"
  example="Uma folha caiu no seu cabelo."
/>

## Sunetele nazale - secretul accentului autentic

Sunetele nazale sunt cele care dau portughezei acel "ceva" special. GÃ¢ndeÈ™te-te cÄƒ vorbeÈ™ti cu nasul Ã®nchis parÈ›ial:

- **ÃƒO** - cel mai comun: pronunÈ›at "aunw" rapid
- **Ã•E** - "oinj" cu nasul
- **ÃƒE** - "aing" scurt

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹" title="Nazalele sunt romantice!">
Portughezii considerÄƒ cÄƒ sunetele nazale dau limbii o calitate melodicÄƒ È™i nostalgicÄƒ. CÃ¢nd spui "Saudade" (nostalgie) corect, cu nasalitate, vei cÃ¢È™tiga instant inimile lor!
</CultureTip>

## Exemple pentru cupluri - PronunÈ›ia Ã®n acÈ›iune

| PortughezÄƒ | Traducere | PronunÈ›ie | Context romantic |
|------------|-----------|-----------|------------------|
| **Querido** | Dragul meu | keh-REE-doh | Pentru partenerul masculin |
| **Querida** | Draga mea | keh-REE-dah | Pentru partenera femininÄƒ |
| **Beijinho** | SÄƒrut mic | bay-ZHEE-nyoh | Pupic drÄƒgÄƒstos |
| **Meu amor** | Iubirea mea | meh-oo ah-MOR | Clasicul niciodatÄƒ nu moare |
| **Docinho** | DulciÈ™or | doh-SEE-nyoh | Alint pentru partener |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹" title="Diminutivele sunt dulci">
Portughezii folosesc des diminutivele pentru a arÄƒta afecÈ›iune. AdaugÄƒ "-inho" sau "-inha" la sfÃ¢rÈ™itul cuvintelor pentru a le face drÄƒgÄƒstoase. "CafÃ©" (cafea) devine "cafÃ©zinho" (cafeaua drÄƒgÄƒstoasÄƒ)!
</CultureTip>

## GreÈ™elile comune È™i cum sÄƒ le eviÈ›i

### 1. **R-ul de la Ã®nceputul cuvintelor**
**GreÈ™it:** pronunÈ›at ca "r" romÃ¢nesc
**Corect:** aproape ca "h" englezesc, dar mai moale

Exemplu: **Rio** se pronunÈ›Äƒ "HEE-oh", nu "Ree-oh"

### 2. **S-urile Ã®ntre vocale**
**GreÈ™it:** Ã®ntotdeauna "s" tare
**Corect:** devine "z" Ã®ntre vocale

Exemplu: **Casa** se pronunÈ›Äƒ "CAH-zah", nu "CAH-sah"

### 3. **Accentul greÈ™it**
**GreÈ™it:** accent pe ultima silabÄƒ fÄƒrÄƒ motiv
**Corect:** urmÄƒreÈ™te penultima silabÄƒ

## ConversaÈ›ie rapidÄƒ - pronunÈ›ie perfectÄƒ

IatÄƒ cÃ¢teva fraze esenÈ›iale pentru cupluri, cu pronunÈ›ie:

1. **"Como estÃ¡s?"** - "Cum eÈ™ti?" - koh-moh ehs-TAHSH
2. **"Saudades de ti"** - "Mi-e dor de tine" - sah-OO-dahdj deh tee
3. **"Que lindo!"** - "CÃ¢t de frumos!" - keh LEEN-doh
4. **"Vamos jantar?"** - "Hai sÄƒ luÄƒm cina?" - VAH-mohzh zhahn-TAH

Pentru mai multe fraze romantice, verificÄƒ [ghidul nostru complet de expresii romantice](/learn/ro/pt/romantic-portuguese-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

## ExerciÈ›ii pentru cupluri

### ExerciÈ›iul 1: Vocale nazale
PracticaÈ›i Ã®mpreunÄƒ: spuneÈ›i "SÃ£o" (sunt) de 10 ori, accentuÃ¢nd nasalitatea
- PronunÈ›ie: "sah-oonw"

### ExerciÈ›iul 2: R-ul portughez
ÃncercaÈ›i sÄƒ spuneÈ›i "Rio de Janeiro" corect
- PronunÈ›ie: "HEE-oh deh zhah-NEH-roh"

### ExerciÈ›iul 3: Diminutive drÄƒgÄƒstoase
TransformaÈ›i cuvinte simple Ã®n termeni de alint:
- "Casa" â†’ "Casinha" (cÄƒsuÈ›a drÄƒgÄƒstoasÄƒ)
- "Beijo" â†’ "Beijinho" (sÄƒrut drÄƒgÄƒstos)

DacÄƒ vrei sÄƒ Ã®nveÈ›i cum sÄƒ-È›i alinti partenerul Ã®n portughezÄƒ, citeÈ™te [ghidul nostru despre porecle romantice](/learn/ro/pt/portuguese-pet-names-and-nicknames/).

## Mic dicÈ›ionar de pronunÈ›ie - Salvare rapidÄƒ

| CuvÃ¢nt portughez | Traducere | PronunÈ›ie rapidÄƒ |
|------------------|-----------|------------------|
| **OlÃ¡** | BunÄƒ | oh-LAH |
| **Tchau** | Pa | chow |
| **Por favor** | VÄƒ rog | por fah-VOR |
| **Desculpa** | Scuze | deh-SHOOL-pah |
| **Obrigada** | MulÈ›umesc (fem.) | oh-bree-GAH-dah |
| **Bom dia** | BunÄƒ dimineaÈ›a | bohn DEE-ah |
| **Boa noite** | Noapte bunÄƒ | BOH-ah noy-cheh |
| **Te amo** | Te iubesc | chee ah-moh |

## UrmÄƒtorii paÈ™i Ã®n cÄƒlÄƒtoria voastrÄƒ

FelicitÄƒri! Ai Ã®nvÄƒÈ›at bazele pronunÈ›iei portugheze. Acum cÄƒ stÄƒpÃ¢neÈ™ti sunetele esenÈ›iale, e timpul sÄƒ:
- PracticÈ›i conversaÈ›ii simple cu partenerul tÄƒu
- ÃnveÈ›i mai multe [expresii de bazÄƒ pentru cupluri](/learn/ro/pt/essential-portuguese-phrases-for-couples/)
- Explorezi [vocabularul pentru Ã®ntÃ¢lniri romantice](/learn/ro/pt/portuguese-date-night-vocabulary/)

AminteÈ™te-È›i: accentul perfect vine cu timpul. Cel mai important este sÄƒ vorbeÈ™ti cu dragoste È™i Ã®ncredere. Partenerul tÄƒu va aprecia efortul tÄƒu mult mai mult decÃ¢t perfecÈ›iunea!

<CTA />

articles.title: Italian Verb Conjugation Basics
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Learning Italian together as a couple creates beautiful memories while strengthening your bond. Italian verb conjugation might seem daunting at first, but when you practice with your **amore** (love), it becomes an exciting journey of discovery. Let's explore the fundamentals of Italian verb conjugation through romantic examples and practical exercises you can enjoy together.

## Understanding Italian Verb Groups

Italian verbs fall into three main conjugation groups, identified by their infinitive endings. Think of these as three different families, each with their own personality:

| Group | Ending | Example | Translation |
|-------|--------|---------|-------------|
| First | -are | **amare** | to love |
| Second | -ere | **vedere** | to see |
| Third | -ire | **sentire** | to feel |

The first group (-are verbs) is the largest and most regular, making it perfect for beginners. When you master **amare** (to love), you'll understand hundreds of other verbs!

<VocabCard
  word="amare"
  translation="to love"
  pronunciation="[ah-MAH-reh]"
  example="Io amo te - I love you"
/>

## Present Tense: Your Foundation

The present tense in Italian expresses current actions, habits, and general truths. For couples, it's essential for expressing daily activities and feelings.

<ConjugationTable
  verb="amare"
  meaning="to love"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "io", word: "amo", translation: "I love" },
    { person: "tu", word: "ami", translation: "you love (informal)" },
    { person: "lui/lei", word: "ama", translation: "he/she loves" },
    { person: "noi", word: "amiamo", translation: "we love" },
    { person: "voi", word: "amate", translation: "you love (plural)" },
    { person: "loro", word: "amano", translation: "they love" }
  ]}
/>

Notice how the stem **am-** remains constant while only the endings change. This pattern applies to all regular -are verbs!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Noi amiamo l'italiano"
  translation="We love Italian"
  pronunciation="[noy ah-mee-AH-mo lee-tah-lee-AH-no]"
  context="Perfect phrase to say when practicing together"
/>

## Essential Verbs for Couples

Let's explore more verbs you'll use daily in your relationship:

<ConjugationTable
  verb="parlare"
  meaning="to speak"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "io", word: "parlo", translation: "I speak" },
    { person: "tu", word: "parli", translation: "you speak" },
    { person: "lui/lei", word: "parla", translation: "he/she speaks" },
    { person: "noi", word: "parliamo", translation: "we speak" },
    { person: "voi", word: "parlate", translation: "you speak (plural)" },
    { person: "loro", word: "parlano", translation: "they speak" }
  ]}
/>

<VocabCard
  word="cucinare"
  translation="to cook"
  pronunciation="[koo-chee-NAH-reh]"
  example="Tu cucini molto bene - You cook very well"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ascoltare"
  translation="to listen"
  pronunciation="[ah-skol-TAH-reh]"
  example="Io ascolto la musica - I listen to music"
/>

## Second Conjugation (-ere verbs)

The second conjugation includes many essential verbs. Let's learn **vedere** (to see), perfect for romantic expressions:

<ConjugationTable
  verb="vedere"
  meaning="to see"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "io", word: "vedo", translation: "I see" },
    { person: "tu", word: "vedi", translation: "you see" },
    { person: "lui/lei", word: "vede", translation: "he/she sees" },
    { person: "noi", word: "vediamo", translation: "we see" },
    { person: "voi", word: "vedete", translation: "you see (plural)" },
    { person: "loro", word: "vedono", translation: "they see" }
  ]}
/>

<CultureTip title="Italian Romance" flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹">
In Italian culture, eye contact is crucial in romantic relationships. The phrase "Ti vedo negli occhi" (I see you in your eyes) expresses deep emotional connection beyond simple sight.
</CultureTip>

## Third Conjugation (-ire verbs)

The third conjugation has two sub-types. Some verbs like **sentire** follow a simple pattern:

<ConjugationTable
  verb="sentire"
  meaning="to feel/hear"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "io", word: "sento", translation: "I feel/hear" },
    { person: "tu", word: "senti", translation: "you feel/hear" },
    { person: "lui/lei", word: "sente", translation: "he/she feels/hears" },
    { person: "noi", word: "sentiamo", translation: "we feel/hear" },
    { person: "voi", word: "sentite", translation: "you feel/hear (plural)" },
    { person: "loro", word: "sentono", translation: "they feel/hear" }
  ]}
/>

Others like **capire** (to understand) add **-isc-** to the stem:

<VocabCard
  word="capire"
  translation="to understand"
  pronunciation="[kah-PEE-reh]"
  example="Io capisco te - I understand you"
/>

## Practice Activities for Couples

### Morning Routine Conjugation
Start each day by taking turns conjugating verbs in your morning routine:
- **Io sveglio** [I wake up] â†’ **Tu svegli** [You wake up]
- **Io bevo caffÃ¨** [I drink coffee] â†’ **Tu bevi caffÃ¨** [You drink coffee]

### Romantic Conjugation Game
One partner says an infinitive verb, the other must conjugate it with a romantic context:
- Partner 1: "**Baciare**" [to kiss]
- Partner 2: "**Io ti bacio ogni mattina**" [I kiss you every morning]

### Daily Activities Chart
Create a weekly chart tracking activities using different verb forms:

| Day | Activity | Italian | English |
|-----|----------|---------|----------|
| Monday | We cook | **Noi cuciniamo** | We cook |
| Tuesday | You listen | **Tu ascolti** | You listen |
| Wednesday | I read | **Io leggo** | I read |

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

### Subject Pronouns
In Italian, subject pronouns (**io, tu, lui/lei**) are often omitted since the verb ending indicates the subject:
- **Amo l'italiano** (I love Italian) âœ“
- **Io amo l'italiano** (I love Italian) âœ“ (for emphasis)

### Formal vs. Informal "You"
**Tu** is informal (for your partner), while **Lei** is formal (for strangers or formal situations).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Come stai?"
  translation="How are you?"
  pronunciation="[KO-meh stah-ee]"
  context="Informal way to ask your partner how they're doing"
/>

## Building Your Vocabulary Together

As you learn conjugations, build your vocabulary with verbs meaningful to your relationship:

<VocabCard
  word="sognare"
  translation="to dream"
  pronunciation="[so-NYAH-reh]"
  example="Noi sogniamo insieme - We dream together"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="viaggiare"
  translation="to travel"
  pronunciation="[vee-ah-JAH-reh]"
  example="Vogliamo viaggiare in Italia - We want to travel to Italy"
/>

## Next Steps in Your Journey

Mastering basic conjugations opens doors to expressing complex ideas and emotions in Italian. Practice regularly together, celebrate small victories, and remember that mistakes are part of learning.

Consider these progression steps:
1. Master present tense regular verbs
2. Learn essential irregular verbs (**essere, avere, fare**)
3. Explore past tenses for sharing memories
4. Practice future tense for making plans together

<CultureTip title="Italian Learning Culture" flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹">
Italians appreciate effort over perfection. Don't worry about making mistakes - your attempts to speak Italian will be met with warmth and encouragement. "Sbagliando si impara" (By making mistakes, one learns) is a common Italian saying.
</CultureTip>

Learning Italian verb conjugation as a couple transforms a potentially dry grammar lesson into an intimate, shared adventure. Every conjugated verb brings you closer to fluency and to each other. **Buona fortuna** [good luck] on your Italian journey together!

<CTA text="Ready to master Italian together?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />

articles.title: Ä°spanyolca Ä°lk BuluÅŸma Ä°fadeleri
articles.content:
Ä°lk buluÅŸma heyecan verici olabilir. Ä°spanyolca konuÅŸan biriyle buluÅŸuyorsanÄ±z, doÄŸru ifadeleri bilmek kendinizi rahat hissetmenize yardÄ±mcÄ± olur.

## KarÅŸÄ±lama ve TanÄ±ÅŸma

## Sohbet BaÅŸlatÄ±cÄ±lar

### 5. "Â¿QuÃ© te gusta hacer para divertirte?"

## Ä°ltifatlar

### 8. "Tienes una sonrisa hermosa"

**Anlam:** "Ã‡ok gÃ¼zel bir gÃ¼lÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼n var"

### 9. "Me encanta tu estilo"

### 10. "Eres muy fÃ¡cil de hablar"

**Anlam:** "Seninle konuÅŸmak Ã§ok kolay"

## BuluÅŸmayÄ± SonlandÄ±rma

### 11. "La pasÃ© muy bien"
**Telaffuz:** *La pase muy biyen*

**Anlam:** "Ã‡ok iyi vakit geÃ§irdim"

### 12. "Â¿Podemos repetir esto algÃºn dÃ­a?"
**Telaffuz:** *Podemos repetir esto algun diya?*

**Anlam:** "Bunu bir gÃ¼n tekrarlayabilir miyiz?"

### 13. "Me encantarÃ­a verte otra vez"
**Telaffuz:** *Me enkantariya verte otra ves*

**Anlam:** "Seni tekrar gÃ¶rmek isterim"

Bu ifadelerle Ä°spanyolca konuÅŸan biriyle baÅŸarÄ±lÄ± bir ilk buluÅŸma yapabilirsiniz.

articles.title: GrÃ¦ske udtryk til at mÃ¸de svigerforÃ¦ldre
articles.content:
# GrÃ¦ske udtryk til at mÃ¸de svigerforÃ¦ldre

I GrÃ¦kenland er familien altafgÃ¸rende. At blive accepteret af svigerforÃ¦ldrene er en stor milepÃ¦l og kan Ã¥bne dÃ¸rene til et varmt og inkluderende familieliv. GrÃ¦kere er berÃ¸mte for deres gÃ¦stfrihed og deres passion for samvÃ¦r.

## Kulturel kontekst

I GrÃ¦kenland hedder svigermor "Ï€ÎµÎ¸ÎµÏÎ¬" (pethera) og svigerfar "Ï€ÎµÎ¸ÎµÏÏŒÏ‚" (petheros). Man bruger "ÎµÏƒÎµÎ¯Ï‚" (eseis - De-formen) til Ã¦ldre, men det er ofte acceptabelt at bruge fornavn efter fÃ¸rste mÃ¸de. Hilsen inkluderer typisk to kindkys.

## Vigtige sÃ¦tninger

### 1. Î§Î±Î¯ÏÏ‰ Ï€Î¿Î»Ï Ï€Î¿Ï… ÏƒÎ±Ï‚ Î³Î½Ï‰ÏÎ¯Î¶Ï‰
**Dansk:** Det glÃ¦der mig meget at mÃ¸de Dem
**Udtale:** he-ro po-li pu sas gno-ri-zo
**RÃ¥d:** Ledsag med et varmt smil og kindkys

### 2. ÎˆÏ‡Ï‰ Î±ÎºÎ¿ÏÏƒÎµÎ¹ Ï€Î¿Î»Î»Î¬ Î³Î¹Î± ÎµÏƒÎ¬Ï‚
**Dansk:** Jeg har hÃ¸rt meget om Dem
**Udtale:** e-ho a-ku-si po-la ya e-sas
**RÃ¥d:** Viser at din partner taler positivt om sin familie

### 3. Î£Î±Ï‚ ÎµÏ…Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¹ÏƒÏ„Ï Ï€Î¿Î»Ï Î³Î¹Î± Ï„Î·Î½ Ï€ÏÏŒÏƒÎºÎ»Î·ÏƒÎ·
**Dansk:** Mange tak for invitationen
**Udtale:** sas ef-ha-ri-sto po-li ya tin pros-kli-si
**RÃ¥d:** GrÃ¦kere vÃ¦rdsÃ¦tter hjertelig taknemmelighed

### 4. Î£Î±Ï‚ Î­Ï†ÎµÏÎ± Î­Î½Î± Î¼Î¹ÎºÏÏŒ Î´ÏÏÎ¿
**Dansk:** Jeg har medbragt en lille gave
**Udtale:** sas e-fe-ra e-na mi-kro do-ro
**RÃ¥d:** Blomster, vin eller desserter (baklava!) er gode valg

### 5. ÎˆÏ‡ÎµÏ„Îµ Î­Î½Î± Ï€Î¿Î»Ï ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î¿ ÏƒÏ€Î¯Ï„Î¹
**Dansk:** De har et meget smukt hjem
**Udtale:** e-he-te e-na po-li o-mor-fo spi-ti
**RÃ¥d:** GrÃ¦kere er stolte af deres hjem og gÃ¦stfrihed

### 6. Î¤Î¿ Ï†Î±Î³Î·Ï„ÏŒ Î®Ï„Î±Î½ ÎµÎ¾Î±Î¹ÏÎµÏ„Î¹ÎºÏŒ
**Dansk:** Maden var enestÃ¥ende
**Udtale:** to fa-yi-to i-tan ek-se-re-ti-ko
**RÃ¥d:** GrÃ¦sk mad er central i kulturen - ros den passioneret

### 7. Î‘Î³Î±Ï€Ï Ï€Î¿Î»Ï Ï„Î¿Î½ Î³Î¹Î¿/Ï„Î·Î½ ÎºÏŒÏÎ· ÏƒÎ±Ï‚
**Dansk:** Jeg elsker Deres sÃ¸n/datter meget
**Udtale:** a-ga-po po-li ton yio / tin ko-ri sas
**RÃ¥d:** GrÃ¦kere vÃ¦rdsÃ¦tter Ã¥bne fÃ¸lelsesmÃ¦ssige udtryk

### 8. Î•Î¯Î¼Î±ÏƒÏ„Îµ Ï€Î¿Î»Ï ÎµÏ…Ï„Ï…Ï‡Î¹ÏƒÎ¼Î­Î½Î¿Î¹ Î¼Î±Î¶Î¯
**Dansk:** Vi er meget lykkelige sammen
**Udtale:** i-ma-ste po-li ef-ti-hiz-me-ni ma-zi
**RÃ¥d:** BekrÃ¦fter forholdets styrke

### 9. Î˜Î± Î®Î¸ÎµÎ»Î± Î½Î± ÏƒÎ±Ï‚ Î³Î½Ï‰ÏÎ¯ÏƒÏ‰ ÎºÎ±Î»ÏÏ„ÎµÏÎ±
**Dansk:** Jeg vil gerne lÃ¦re Dem bedre at kende
**Udtale:** tha i-the-la na sas gno-ri-so ka-li-te-ra
**RÃ¥d:** Viser Ã¦gte interesse i familien

### 10. ÎœÏ€Î¿ÏÏ Î½Î± Î²Î¿Î·Î¸Î®ÏƒÏ‰ ÏƒÎµ ÎºÎ¬Ï„Î¹;
**Dansk:** Kan jeg hjÃ¦lpe med noget?
**Udtale:** bo-ro na vo-i-thi-so se ka-ti
**RÃ¥d:** At tilbyde hjÃ¦lp viser respekt og god opdragelse

### 11. Î•Î¯Î½Î±Î¹ Î¼Î¹Î± Ï…Ï€Î­ÏÎ¿Ï‡Î· Î¿Î¹ÎºÎ¿Î³ÎµÎ½ÎµÎ¹Î±ÎºÎ® Ï€Î±ÏÎ¬Î´Î¿ÏƒÎ·
**Dansk:** Det er en vidunderlig familietradition
**Udtale:** i-ne mia i-pe-ro-hi i-ko-ye-ni-a-ki pa-ra-do-si
**RÃ¥d:** Vis interesse for grÃ¦ske traditioner

### 12. Î‘Î½Ï…Ï€Î¿Î¼Î¿Î½Ï Î½Î± ÏƒÎ±Ï‚ Î¾Î±Î½Î±Î´Ï
**Dansk:** Jeg kan ikke vente med at se Dem igen
**Udtale:** a-ni-po-mo-no na sas ksa-na-do
**RÃ¥d:** Vis entusiasme for fremtidige mÃ¸der

## Yderligere kulturelle tips

**GÃ¦stfrihed (Filoxenia):** GrÃ¦sk gÃ¦stfrihed er legendarisk. Forvent at blive behandlet som royalty. AcceptÃ©r gÃ¦stfriheden med taknemmelighed.

**Mad:** Spis godt! At nÃ¦gte mad kan opfattes som uhÃ¸fligt. Forvent masser af retter - moussaka, souvlaki, tzatziki, feta og meget mere. "ÎšÎ±Î»Î® ÏŒÏÎµÎ¾Î·!" (kali oreksi - velbekomme) siges fÃ¸r mÃ¥ltidet.

**Ouzo:** Hvis ouzo eller tsipouro tilbydes, deltag. "Î£Ï„Î·Î½ Ï…Î³ÎµÎ¹Î¬ ÏƒÎ±Ï‚!" (stin iyia sas - til Deres sundhed) er skÃ¥len. Drik altid ouzo med meze (smÃ¥ retter).

**Familie:** GrÃ¦ske familier er tÃ¦tte og involverede. Forvent mange spÃ¸rgsmÃ¥l om dit liv, din familie og dine planer.

**Religion:** GrÃ¦kenland er overvejende grÃ¦sk-ortodoks. Vis respekt for religiÃ¸se ikoner og traditioner, isÃ¦r omkring pÃ¥ske og andre helligdage.

**Tid:** GrÃ¦kere har et mere afslappet forhold til tid end skandinaver. VÃ¦r tÃ¥lmodig - sociale arrangementer kan vare lÃ¦ngere end forventet.

**Komplimenter:** VÃ¦r generÃ¸s med komplimenter, men pas pÃ¥ "matiasma" (det onde Ã¸je) - nogle grÃ¦kere er overtroiske. Hvis du roser noget for meget, kan de sige "ftou ftou ftou" for at afvÃ¦rge ulykke.

**PÃ¥ske:** GrÃ¦sk pÃ¥ske er den vigtigste hÃ¸jtid. Hvis du inviteres til pÃ¥skefejring, er det et stort tegn pÃ¥ accept.

**Samtaleemner:** GrÃ¦kere elsker at diskutere politik, historie, filosofi og sport (fodbold). De er passionerede samtalepartnere - deltag aktivt!

Med disse udtryk og kulturelle tips er du godt forberedt til at mÃ¸de dine grÃ¦ske svigerforÃ¦ldre. ÎšÎ±Î»Î® Ï„ÏÏ‡Î·! (Held og lykke!)
